item.title: HubSpot phishing targets 20,000 Microsoft Azure accounts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A phishing campaign targeting automotive, chemical, and industrial manufacturing companies in Germany and the UK is abusing HubSpot to steal Microsoft Azure account credentials. [...]

item.title: CISA urges switch to Signal-like encrypted messaging apps after telecom hacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Today, CISA urged senior government and political officials to switch to end-to-end encrypted messaging apps like Signal following a wave of telecom breaches across dozens of countries, including eight carriers in the United States. [...]

item.title: Malicious Microsoft VSCode extensions target devs, crypto community
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Malicious Visual Studio Code extensions were discovered on the VSCode marketplace that download heavily obfuscated PowerShell payloads to target developers and cryptocurrency projects in supply chain attacks. [...]

item.title: Recorded Future CEO applauds "undesirable" designation by Russia
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Recorded Future, an American threat intelligence company, has become the first cybersecurity firm designated by the Russian government as an "undesirable" organization. [...]

item.title: Interpol replaces dehumanizing "Pig Butchering" term with "Romance Baiting"
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Interpol calls on the cybersecurity community, law enforcement, and the media to stop using the term "Pig Butchering" when referring to online relationship and investment scams, as it unnecessarily shames the victims impacted by these fraud campaigns. [...]

item.title: NVIDIA shares fix for game performance issues with new NVIDIA App
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Nvidia has shared a temporary fix for a known issue impacting systems running its recently unveiled NVIDIA App and causing gaming performance to drop by up to 15%. [...]

item.title: 'Bitter' cyberspies target defense orgs with new MiyaRAT malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A cyberespionage threat group known as 'Bitter' was observed targeting defense organizations in Turkey using a novel malware family named MiyaRAT. [...]

item.title: New fake Ledger data breach emails try to steal crypto wallets
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A new Ledger phishing campaign is underway that pretends to be a data breach notification asking you to verify your recovery phrase, which is then stolen and used to steal your cryptocurrency. [...]

item.title: CISA orders federal agencies to secure Microsoft 365 tenants
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​CISA has issued this year's first binding operational directive (BOD 25-01), ordering federal civilian agencies to secure their Microsoft 365 cloud environments by implementing a list of required configuration baselines. [...]

item.title: New critical Apache Struts flaw exploited to find vulnerable servers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A recently patched critical Apache Struts 2 vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-53677 is actively exploited using public proof-of-concept exploits to find vulnerable devices. [...]

item.title: Ireland fines Meta $264 million over 2018 Facebook data breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Irish Data Protection Commission (DPC) fined Meta €251 million ($263.6M) over General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) violations arising from a 2018 personal data breach impacting 29 million Facebook accounts. [...]

item.title: Over 25,000 SonicWall VPN Firewalls exposed to critical flaws
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 25,000 publicly accessible SonicWall SSLVPN devices are vulnerable to critical severity flaws, with 20,000 using a SonicOS/OSX firmware version that the vendor no longer supports. [...]

item.title: Might need a mass password reset one day? Read this first.
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: Organizations are often caught off-guard when a data breaches occurs, forcing them to quickly perform mass password resets Learn from Specops Software about some of the common mass password reset scenarios and the challenges you may face. [...]
